intro: Diodia lippioides, commonly known as False Verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its small, white or purple flowers and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant is typically found in dry, open habitats such as roadsides and disturbed soils. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. Diodia lippioides is often used in herbal remedies for its purported medicinal properties.
